block.p: Sylvia Kneeland Kimball, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard A. Kimball Jr. of Millbrook, N.Y., was married yesterday to Christopher Drake Perry, a son of Rachel C. Claflin of Boston and A. Wade Perry of Lincoln, Mass. The Rev. Louise Conant performed the ceremony at Christ Episcopal Church in Cambridge, Mass.

The bride, 29, is an associate marketing manager at Harvard Pilgrim Health Care, a health maintenance organization in Boston. She graduated from Yale University and received a master's degree in public health from Harvard University.

Sylvia Kneeland Kimball, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard A. Kimball Jr. of Millbrook, N.Y., was married yesterday to Christopher Drake Perry, a son of Rachel C. Claflin of Boston and A. Wade Perry of Lincoln, Mass. The Rev. Louise Conant performed the ceremony at Christ Episcopal Church in Cambridge, Mass.

The bride, 29, is an associate marketing manager at Harvard Pilgrim Health Care, a health maintenance organization in Boston. She graduated from Yale University and received a master's degree in public health from Harvard University.
Her father is of counsel to Hughes, Hubbard & Reed, a New York law firm, and the chairman of the Dutchess Land Conservancy, a land trust in Millbrook.

The bridegroom, 30, is an associate at Sherburne, Powers & Needham, a Boston law firm. He graduated from Wesleyan University and received a J.D. degree from Boston College Law School. His father is a retired architect and photographer who worked in Lincoln.
